Question: 23 years s brought to ER with perforating anterior chest wound. Which one of the  following about the anterior chest of the heart?
Option 1: It has its right border formed mainly be left ventricle
Option 2: It has a coronary sinus passing across it
Option 3: It is directly related to diaphragm
Option 4: It mainly formed by left atrium and left ventricle
Option 5: It mainly formed by right atrium and right ventricle
Correct Answer: It mainly formed by right atrium and right ventricle

A 58-year-old man, admitted for inguinal hernia surgery, is found to have an enlarged  heart shadow on his chest radiograph. Which one of the following statements Is true of  the right ventricle?
Option 1: Has a muscular wall that is normally thicker than that of the Left ventricle
Option 2: Forms the apex of the heart
Option 3: Forms the right border of the heart
Option 4: Is directly related to the diaphragm
Correct Answer: Is directly related to the diaphragm

Question: A 23-year-old man presents to the Emergency Department with non-specific chest pain. A  postero-anterior (PA) chest radiograph is performed and it is normal. Immediately inferior  to the outline of the aortic knuckle was a farther structure with a convex border. What is  this structure?

Which is correct related to anterior surface of the heart

Option 3: Right coronary artery give inter-ventricular artery
Option 4: Circumflex anastomosis with right coronary artery
Option 5: The left atrium form the base of the heart
Correct Answer: Pulmonary artery infundibulum from right ventricle

Question: A 54 years-old man suffered from chylothorax after thoracotomy for esophagectomy  for removal of esophageal cancer. In which site the Thoracic duct mostly injured?
Option 1: Before it entered subclavian in neck
Option 2: At pleural reflection in superior mediastinum
Option 3: during its course from diaphragm before it reached superior mediastinum
Option 4: at its crossing in front carotid sheath
Correct Answer: during its course from diaphragm before it reached superior mediastinum
